title: (chore) use same style in switch in both platforms
(bug): Pressing the "check for updates" button in the iOS app does nothing.
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

(Summarize the bug encountered concisely)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Press "Settings"
2. Press "Check for updates"

### Platform information

iOS 12.1 / iPhone SE

### App version

3.2.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Pressing the "check for updates" button in the iOS app does nothing.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Pressing the "check for updates" button should actually check if there's an update and if there is, allow the user to install it. If not, it should let them know that the app is up to date.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: (feat): collect mobile app version number for better understanding of which users need to update
description:
## Goal

We need to understand the version of our mobile app that our users are on so that we can notify the users on old versions that they need to update the app

description:
Due to this issue https://github.com/facebook/react-native/issues/12534
The red pulse is limited to the container borders

(Feat): topbar should minimize scrolling down on newsfeed
(bug): Can't see comment replies without scrolling down
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

From the user 

Every so often when someone replies to one of my comments I can’t see them at all. The screen video shows me clicking on it multiple times but nothing shows (see link below)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Login to app.
2. Go to a popular post (try in Help and Support), make sure it has comment reply trees. 
3. Position the screen so the reply button is at the bottom. 
4. Click it
5. Observe you have to scroll down to see the comment.

### Platform information 

Replicated Ubuntu / Chromium

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

User has to scroll down to see their comment replies.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

It should auto-scroll.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

[**Video in link**]
https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/944094010648371200

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: (bug): Android Blog comments showing previous posts comments when browsing through.
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### 

Blog posts will show the comments of the previously viewed post rather than the current one. 

### Steps to reproduce

1.  Visit the blogs section
2.  Open a blog, scroll down to see the comments
3.  Go back, click the next blog
4.  Scroll down to the comments

### Platform information

Android S7 Edge (8.0.0)

### App version

v3.2.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Comments are shown for the previous post.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The correct comments should be shown.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/947150458587721728

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

(bug): Deleting all characters in email address listed on "Change Email" page in settings causes white screen with loading icon which spins forever.
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

See screen recording below. Also, holding down the backspace button causes the same issue once one character been deleted. The only way to replace the current email address (at least in the iOS app) is to hold --> select all and paste the new email address.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Press options button
2. Press "Settings"
3. Press "Email"
4. Tap the input field
5. Press the backspace button until all characters are deleted

### Platform information

iOS 12.1 / iPhone SE

### App version

3.2.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Deleting all characters in email address listed on "Change Email" page in settings causes white screen with loading icon which spins forever. Also, holding down the backspace button causes the same issue once one character has been deleted.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

You should be able to delete all characters either by tapping or holding the backspace button so you can then start typing the new email address.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![39](/uploads/bc625c1416505fd6cbd1b1a976b20951/39.mp4)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Remind should return user to exact place from whence they reminded
description:
### Summary

Remind action delivers user back to your newsfeed instead of back to where you reminded from

### Steps to reproduce

Go to a channel, Remind a post, and after the Remind you are delivered back to your own newsfeed

### Platform
IOS

### App version

 3.2.0 (201902170002)

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

After the Remind the user is sent to their newsfeed instead of the place hat they reminded from. Even if you Remind from your own newsfeed, you are not be returned to the exact spot from which you reminded 

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

User should be returned to the exact spot from where they reminded 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: (bug): Users should be able to scroll infinitely through their phone's gallery images when uploading an image.
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When uploading an image, only the 30 most recent images in the phone's camera roll are displayed. When you scroll to the bottom, nothing happens. It should load infinitely like on other social media apps.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the app and visit the home page.
2. Click the create post button.
3. Click the paperclip icon.
4. Scroll to the bottom.

### Platform information

iOS app.

### App version

v3.1.2

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Only the 30 most recent images in the phone's camera roll are displayed. When you scroll to the bottom, nothing happens.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

It should load infinitely like on other social media apps.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When you are replying to a comment, and you click to open the reply thread and start typing, the app jumps all the way to the bottom of the comment thread and you lose your place.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Go to a post with a lot of comments (10+)
2. Click to reply to the first comment 
3. Notice app jumps you to bottom

### Platform information

iphone 7 ios 12.1 

### App version

3.2

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

You should stay in the same place on the app where you can see the comment reply entry field.


### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

title: (bug) current jest version is ignoring the cache
(bug): notifications for comment replies displaying error message
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

In my mobile notifications, I am receiving notifications that are not displaying correctly when a user replies to my comment inside of a group conversation. 

*This is also happening on comments on regular posts for 3.2 Android.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to group conversation and comment
2. Reply to comment with another channel
3. View notification for reply on mobile app iOS

### Platform information

iOS iphone 7
Android Galaxy S9

### App version

3.1.2
3.2.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Displays text that says "Faizan commented on ...oops"

On Android, reads [user] commented on [content].  Then shows "(..."

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Should read "Faizan replied to your comment" with link to comment, with reply opened up. 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

title: (feat) Add empty message to discovery

(bug): Images Library Has Disappeared
description:
### Summary

The image library that was once available on a channel's left sidebar, under the Bio, has disappeared; making it impossible to browse a channels uploaded images.

### Steps to reproduce

Open a channel page and scroll down to just below the channel's Bio, and on top of the Video library, and you wont see what was once there; the image library.

### Platform information 

Firefox 30.3.0 esr; Debian Stretch 9.6

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The lack of a channels image libary.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

An image library should be available just below the Bio and above the video library on a users channel.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![Selection_526](/uploads/dcf1b1074ad057e92a9ae335a5f5dd82/Selection_526.png)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

description: This version fixed the issue in the FlatList footer and header: upside down if inverted is true

(bug) code updated with codepush is lost after restart
Reimplement deeplinking
description: We should bring back deep linking to the app. Currently, the only thing that is blocking us to implement deep linking on some specific routes and not in every route is the URL of the channels. We should move the channels from minds.com/msantangelo to minds.com/channel/msantangelo (and implement a redirect on the frontend to support the old routes too)

title: (bug) auto linking of libs failing because java files are not in the correct folder
(bug)[mobile]: @name tags do not link in messenger
description:
### Summary
@nametags are unpedictable and do not link consistently in messenger chat boxes

### Steps to reproduce

Clink on a highlighted @name link in a messenger chat bubble and it thinks you want to copy/select all

### Platform information

iOS mobile 

### App version

Testflight version 3.1.1000 (201901210001)

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

when you tap the @name tag the app struggles to realize it is a link and attempts to do a copy/select/paste, but if you keep tapping, you can sometimes make it link. If there are more than one @name tags in a series like @mark, @john, then it will just highlight the entire bubble

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

should easily link to the channel page of the @name link

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: (bug): Tap twice on groups and press back button causes instant loading
description:
### Summary

Note: According to my experience if user double taps on some buttons and it opens the same screen twice it might cause the crash in some apps

### Steps to reproduce

1. Start the application
2. Go to groups
3. User sees the list of the groups
4. Tap twice on the group (it will show the group screen twice)
5. Press back button

### Platform information

samsung (samsung SM-J710F) / Android 8.1.0

### App version

December 6 (1) / 1

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

user is able to open the same screen twice and once presses back button app instantly loading

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

User is not able to tap twice on one button. Also back button will send user to the groups list

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

https://mega.nz/#!xUMyGCYa!SeO4tYsTqv3E9RqHaKaD299DQOeuTX3gmKRK_OOeEDU

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

(Summarize the bug encountered concisely)

2. Login to the app
3. Go to groups
4. Open any subscribed group
